image.altText: Kira Korolev stands outside the war memorial in Canberra

props.synopsis: Australia's spy agency ASIO was the first authority to investigate concerns about Russian-born Australian citizen Kira Korolev. What followed was close monitoring of the army private and her husband, which has now landed them in custody, facing allegations of spying for their mother country.

title.children: ASIO 'monitored Brisbane couple for period of time' before they were charged over Russian espionage

image.altText: A woman in a red shirt and sunglasses smiles in front of the sea.

props.synopsis: Australian citizen Kira Korolev, an alleged Russian spy, was working as an assistant theatre director in Perth in 2010.Â

title.children: Alleged Russian spy worked as assistant theatre director in Perth

image.altText: Indigenous woman with white long hair on a bus resting her head against a pillow.

props.synopsis: The connection between Kalgoorlie and Western Australia's outback is a critical one for remote community residents.

title.children: A small bus is helping residents of some of Australia's most remote communities to return home safely

image.altText: An Indigenous man standing in front of an Aboriginal flag.

props.synopsis: How much do you really know about the Stolen Generations? A group of documentary filmmakers say their confronting new project is another stepping stone to achieving healing for those affected by WA's dark past.

title.children: 'Confronting' film explores how 100k children were forcibly removed from their families

image.altText: Albanese wearing black rimmed glasses is seen in portrait wearing a pink shirt and black suit

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has accused the Kremlin of spying "around the world" after the arrests of two Australian citizens on espionage charges.

title.children: Albanese tells Russia to 'back off' after embassy criticises spying allegations

image.altText: Leinster shire president Peter Craig leaning on the back of a ute and looking into the camera.

props.synopsis: To some, it was no surprise â perhaps it was even inevitable â that BHP would choose to close its WA nickel mines and smelters. But the decision has left people living and working in nearby towns feeling numb.

title.children: Nickel operation closures leave towns in WA's Goldfields facing uncertain future

image.altText: A Western Bulldogs AFL player rises high to take a pack mark during a game, as other players grimace.

props.synopsis:
Cody Weightman's hanger charges up the Bulldogs to a crucial win over the Blues, as the Demons and Bombers play a huge match at a wet MCG. Follow all the action in our live blog.

Â

title.children: Dogs score crucial win over the Blues as Dons and Dees face season defining clash at the MCG

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: FT: Western Bulldogs beat Carlton by 14 points
3QT: Western Bulldogs lead Carlton by 10 points
HT: Western Bulldogs lead Carlton by three points

image.altText: A man in a suit leans down while being embraced by a brunette woman in a grey suit, sombre

props.synopsis: A New Mexico judge has dismissed involuntary manslaughter charges against actor Alec Baldwin over the shooting of Rust cinematographer Halyna Hutchins in 2021.

title.children: Alec Baldwin breaks down in tears as judge dismisses charges over Rust movie set killing

image.altText: Two firefighters spray water into a window, while a man in a grey shirt points up at it.

props.synopsis: Israeli forces have pulled back from parts of Gaza City overnight, after a fierce, week-long offensive that met with Hamas resistance.

title.children: Dozens dead after Israel scales back Gaza City offensive against Hamas

image.altText: A soldier motions to the camera to move away as a huge truck drives into frame onto a pier off a huge boat

props.synopsis: While it was never touted as a complete solution to the problems of getting humanitarian aid into Gaza, the US has announced its temporary aid pier will be shut down after being plagued with challenges.

title.children: How the US-built pier to get aid into Gaza was supposed to work â and why it didn't

image.altText: CCTV vision of a hooded figure walking down a hotel corridor.

props.synopsis: Police and officials in the Philippines are trying to reassure locals and tourists the area remains safe after a triple murder.Â

title.children: The eight seconds of CCTV that shows a man enter a Philippine hotel room where two Australians were found dead

image.altText: A man runs the ball during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Broncos have lost five-straight NRL matches and sit outside the top eight. They take on a Dragons side with finals aspirations of their own at Lang Park. Follow live.

title.children: Brisbane and St George face season-defining clash at Lang Park

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Gold Coast claim third-straight victory, beating Parramatta 24-16

image.altText: John Setka sitting behind a number of microphones at a Melbourne media conference.

props.synopsis: Nine newspapers are alleging underworld figures have been given high-paid roles within the Victorian branch of the construction union.

title.children: Serious allegations against the CFMEU a day after construction union boss Setka quits

image.altText: A gaunt man in brown prison garb stares straight ahead at the camera

props.synopsis: Hamza Elbaf has been shut off from the outside world for the past five years. The Australian citizen doesn't even know who the prime minister is. He's one of thousands of suspected ISIS fighters being held in Syrian prisons.

title.children: What was this rugby league fan from the suburbs doing with ISIS?

image.altText: aerial rooftops in inner suburbs

props.synopsis: Australia's property obsession has made us among the richest in the world, but it's also saddled households with enormous debts, and made monetary policy decisions even harder.

title.children: Untold riches and enormous debt: why property will hold sway at the next RBA meeting

image.altText: Anthony Albanese smiling as an excited voter, a young woman, takes a selfie with him.

props.synopsis: After all the bleak headlines of the past couple of weeks, Albanese's cheery optimism may seem a little weird. But some in the government can't believe they're not "cooked".

title.children: 13 rate rises could be expected to 'cook' a government â but some Albanese insiders can't believe the polls

image.altText: Two surfers, one lying on his surfboard and other wave jumping on top of a blue-green wave with a modern building behind them.

props.synopsis: The battle for the surf has moved from the ocean to the pool where rival companies are spending tens of millions of dollars to create the perfect artificial wave.

title.children: Are wave parks the answer to 'surf rage'?

image.altText: A close up of a person holding a smartphone with a Donald Trump button on the back

props.synopsis: The social media company says it has a responsibility to ensure Americans can hear from nominees for the US presidency.Â

title.children: Meta lifts restrictions on Trump's Facebook and Instagram accounts

image.altText: Tweed boat 3

props.synopsis: One man is dead and another man has been rushed to hospital after their boat overturned in rough seas while trying to cross the Tweed River bar in far northern NSW.

title.children: Man dies after boat capsizes in rough seas while trying to cross the Tweed River bar

image.altText: Caged hen at Werribee in Victoria

props.synopsis: Farmers and virologists have called for more funding to protect the country's native and commercial birds, with fears the H5 variant could arrive within months.

title.children: Experts warn Australia not investing enough to prepare for 'catastrophic' affects of H5 bird flu variant

image.altText: Joe Biden shakes hands with Octavia Spencer.

props.synopsis: A day after a prime-time press conference that gifted his opponents two highly shareable gaffes, Joe Biden travels to Michigan and makes light of complaints about his age.

title.children: Biden jokes about his age and gaffes on campaign trail in Detroit

image.altText: an old man sits on a chair and leans on a walking stick with a desk in front of him and curtains covering a window

props.synopsis: As Maggie Beer brings out a new television program with a focus on elderly citizens, while we witness the US President Joe Biden once again stumble â the complexities of ageing once again comes to the surface.Â

title.children: Is it time to address the prominence of arrogance as we age?

image.altText: Large bottles of yellow cooking oil being filled at a factory.

props.synopsis: Australia has been importing cooking oils from one of the companies implicated in a food safety scandal in China, the Department of Agriculture has confirmed.

title.children: China is facing a contaminated cooking oil crisis. Is Australia at risk?

image.altText: Two race cars tangle on a race track as smoke fills the air.

props.synopsis: A graceful slide into a corner at around 200 kilometres an hour is just another night behind the wheel for this Queensland race car driver. Ben Barnes' burnouts and epic drifts are taking Australian race tracks by storm.

title.children: Daredevil drifter's burnouts and 200kph corner slides are turning heads for all the right reasons

image.altText: A composite image of John Cena, Priyanka Chopra, Nick Jonas and Tony Blair

props.synopsis: With pre-parties featuring performances by pop stars Rihanna and Justin Bieber, the wedding of Anant Ambani and Radhika Merchant was never going to be a low-key affair.

title.children: Rihanna and Justin Bieber kick off Ambani-Merchant wedding festivities with star-studded pre-parties

image.altText: A woman drives a tractor during a tobacco harvest

props.synopsis: A fortnightly gathering over the past four decades has slowly rolled these former tobacco farmers â once isolated, a world away from their Italian homes â into a family.

title.children: From chasing thieves to working 16-hour days, former tobacco farmers have rich memories of life on the land

image.altText: A tall apartment building under construction

props.synopsis: There are 100,000 properties sitting vacant in Melbourne during a housing crisis, and it speaks to "deep inequality", a new report says.

title.children: Report reveals 100,000 Melbourne homes were vacant in 2023

image.altText: Four large winged aircraft sit on the back of trucks that are driving down a road while on parade

props.synopsis: Officials say the technology will allow them to shoot down unmanned aerial vehicles from the North but not all experts are convinced.

title.children: South Korea says it can shoot down North Korean drones using lasers for $2.15 a shot

image.altText: James Anderson waves to the Lord's crowd as he leaves the field in his final Test for England.

props.synopsis: James Anderson signs off from international cricket with his 704th and final Test wicket, ending a glittering 21-year career during England's emphatic win over West Indies.

title.children: England cricket great Anderson retires with one final flourish

image.altText: Black and white photo of school boy smiling. Colour photo of man with grey hair in a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: After a humble upbringing marred by racial prejudice and social disadvantage, Ken Wyatt broke new ground for First Nations Australians wanting to have a say in federal decision-making. This is his story.

title.children: From racial prejudice to political triumph, Ken Wyatt's story is of resilience and leadership

image.altText: A bowl of rice pudding with a sprinkling of brown sugar on a sunny table, the recipe is made on the stove.

props.synopsis: Rice pudding is an easy dessert made with simple ingredients. This version is cooked on the stove and is made custard-like with the addition of eggs.

title.children: An easy rice pudding, made on the stove

image.altText: Protesters sit down and chant at the Australian National University pro-Palestine encampment.

props.synopsis: The Australian National University has acknowledged "changing expectations" around its investments.

title.children: ANU to review military investments after pro-Palestine protests

image.altText: An old metal building

props.synopsis: Toganmain, in the New South Wales Riverina, is regarded as one of Australia's most significant woolsheds, and holds the record for the most sheep shorn in a single month. But the woolshed is at risk of being lost.

title.children: This massive woolshed is crumbling after two decades of disuse. Volunteers fear it will be lost in the next big wind storm
